results.title: The Little convict
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films, Yoram Gross and Sandra Gross
results.brief_description: In old New South Wales a new batch of convicts arrives including the little convict, young Toby Nelson. Consigned to a Government farm they are subjected to the cruelty of their tyrannical overseers, Sergeant Billy Langden and Corporal Weazel Wesley, finally resulting in the death of the pickpocket, Old Dipper. Toby escapes and flees into the alien Australian bush where he is saved from death by the aboriginal boy Wahroonga. Together with another escapee, highwayman Jack Doolan, and Wahroonga’s animal friends, they launch a spectacular mission to rescue the blacksmith Big George and Toby’s sister Polly. With Rolf Harris as a storyteller and the magic of live action and animation, this wonderful Australian historical adventure comes joyously to life.

results.title: The little chimney sweep
results.creator_credit: Primrose Productions, Louis Hagen, Richard Kaplan and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: An example of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films, re-cut and given a new sountrack. Tells the tale of a little chimney sweep from 18th century London who comes down the wrong chimney and meets a rich young heiress.

results.title: The Little black box = Hei xia die xue ji = 黑匣喋血记
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio and Zhong Shuhuang
results.brief_description:
On the eve of the 1911 Xinhai Revolution, Jinbiao, a Kungfu master, was selected to bring back a confidential document from Guangzhou. Jinbiao got the document in a little black box from another Kungfu master, Nan. Shortly after Jinbiao left, the government soldiers came to Nan’s house. Nan was killed and his dauguhter, Guiying and nephew, Jianxiong escaped. On his way back to Wuhan, Jinbiao was tailed and attacked by a masked person. In Changsha, Jinbiao sought help from Nan’s friend, Liu. But Jianxiong also came, telling everybody that Nan was killed and he lost touch with Guiying. Since Jinbiao and Jianxiong came to Liu’s house, a series incidents happened with one of Liu’s apprentice killed. Liu suspected Jinbiao and wanted to kill him. While Jinbiao was in touble, Guiying came and tried to convince Liu that Jinbiao was innocent. Later, Liu found out that Jianxiong was a spy of the Qing government, who plotted all the killing. In the end, Jianxiong was killed, but both Liu and Guiying also died in the fight with Jianxiong and the government soldiers in order to save Jinbiao, who eventually accomplished the mission. The Xinhai Revolution was the overthrow of China’s ruling Qing Dynasty in the early 1910s.

Martial arts film became a popular genre in Chinese cinema after The Shaolin Temple (1982) became a huge success in the early 1980s. Since the mid-1980s, the Chinese film industry went through a series of structural transformations aimed at marketization. In 1984, film was redefined to be an integral part of cultural industries instead of political institutions for the enforcement of Communist ideology. As a result, film studios began to produce more market-oriented films. This martial arts film reflected such a trend. This film combines elements of different genres such as martial arts and suspense. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Litterbug
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Modern science continues to wage its war on pests of all type. But even science makes little progress against that contemptible pest - the litterbug. Who but Donald Duck should be better suited to portray this scourge of the cities beaches and mountains. With great skill, daring and deep dedication to his task, he methodically deposits his litter for all to see, happy in the realisation that no likely spot has been overlooked.

results.title: The Lion tamer
results.creator_credit: Van Beuren Corporation, Official Films, Amadee J Van Beuren and George Stallings
results.brief_description: Amos (Freeman Gosden) and Andy (Charles Correll) become lion tamers at the circus. With the real lion being too ferocious, Amos and Andy decide to trick the crowd by “taming” a fake lion - a lion costume with two men inside. However, the real lion escapes and unbeknownst to Amos, gets into the cage with him, whilst the fake lion runs away. All hell breaks loose as Amos tries to fend off the hungry lion.

results.title: The Lion King: Timon and Pumbaa
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Tony Craig, Bobs Gannaway, Rob LaDuca, Steve Moore and Jeff DeGrandis
results.brief_description: The Lion King’s lovable pals Timon and Pumbaa enjoy starring roles in their first solo video. Pumbaa is struck by lightning and as a result develops amnesia and has no recollection of his friend Timon and the adventures they have shared. Timon tries his hardest to restore his friends memory, and recalls some of their adventures around the world.

results.title: The Lion in the doorway
results.creator_credit: Macau Light Films, O J Productions, Christina Ferguson and Prabhubodha Walker
results.brief_description: A satirical, experimental, metaphysical western. A cowboy figure joins those of Icarus and Pierrot and encounters some less than lovely aspects of wild west culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Macau Light Films, O J Productions, Christina Ferguson and Prabhubodha Walker

results.title: The Lion and the mouse
results.brief_description: Through an amusing cartoon interpretation of an Aesopean fable, children learn that size alone does not determine how helpful a person can be. We see the king of the jungle, a lion, laugh at the idea that a tiny mouse could ever help him. But when a speck of dirt gets into the lion’s eye, it is the little mouse who removes it and proves to be a helpful friend after all.

results.title: The Lion and the mouse
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: This film is a visual adaptation of the famous Aesop Fable “The Lion and the Mouse”. Delightfully rendered, it is an exquisite tapestry of animation cut-outs. Sound film without commentary.
